description: From caco- +â€Ž -graphy, perhaps after Middle French cacographie.

entries.meaning: Bad spelling or punctuation, especially unintuitive spellings considered as a feature of a whole language or dialect. [from 16th c.]
examples: A phrase exhibits proofs of cacography, when the accents are misplaced, forgotten, or used erroneously.
Many illegible letters is the sign of disorder, and the illegibility of Greeley's cacography has furnished numberless anecdotes.
